column4: wow, IRC using empathy... that's new to me... well empathy is new too
I'm running natty...
had to get rid of unity though
i didn't like it for the desktop (prob just not use to it)
it's good on my wife's netbook though... perfect interface
bobby did u do an upgrade?
or fresh install
did upgrade from 10.04, to 10.10 then 11.04
lol, yeah motsly the unity was an issue. on limited screen you don't want something that wouldn't just go away.
they said it would autohide in 11.04 but it NEVER loaded.
nah. I don't really setup auto login.
10.04 wokrs. so no need to really keep upgrading.
lol had to reinstall.
'coz officially downgrading is not supported.
it has a netbook interface and classes. the netbook interface is like old look. but it works great.
it has the on desktop application browser thing....
nah, is it really nice? is that why you ask?
I just figured 10.04 was working nice, why bother.
I like the 10.04 way of doing it.
it's nice to see the app have it's own icon instead of unity trying to do windows 7 things.
the win 7 I really really like. the kde I like too. I like eyecandy
lol, that's where you create a system image, and teach them how to restore.
but if they like kubuntu,that's solving the windows thing.
